intro: Erythrina hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras coral tree, is a deciduous legume native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers, which bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Erythrina hondurensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
